audio.transcript: Parents can respect their child's feelings by taking time to listen carefully. Listening with empathy and validating your child's feelings are two of the most important steps to take in order to help children learn to succeed with emotions. Knowing that an adult will listen and try to understand what they are feeling can be just the kind of comfort they need. Click the photo to hear an example of how a parent can show his or her child that feelings are important.

audio.transcript: Ben's daughter Sophia begins crying at her friend's birthday party when she sees her friend opening presents. Ben knows that Sophia is sad that the presents are not for her. He knows that simply explaining to Sophia that she will get presents on her birthday would not be effective Emotion Coaching. Instead he decides to take Sophia aside to ask her about her feelings. Ben is careful to stop and listen to her response.

Parents can tend to explain too much to a child, for too long. This can lead the child to miss the information that the parent is trying to communicate and, as a result, feel disconnected emotionally from the parent.
